Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can illustrate a detailed scenario where two students are positioned at a distance requiring long-distance communication.
The student can accurately depict a string telephone device, clearly showing cups connected by a taut string.
The student can visually represent how sound travels through the string using directional arrows or labels, indicating the transfer of sound.
The student can show the entire setup clearly, with cups held to the students' ears and mouths, demonstrating the communication process.
The student can include labels and annotations explaining how the string carries sound more effectively when it's taut and straight.
The student can portray the scenario in a way that highlights the practical application and the functionality of the device in overcoming communication barriers.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details, such as not consistently showing facial expressions or body language that might enhance understanding of the communication (though this is not essential to understanding the device's function).
The student might forget to label every part of the device, but this does not impact the overall integrity of the representation (e.g., forgetting to label one of the strings or the base of a cup).
